items.description: This tutorial is intended to give a taste of what making games in Defold is about. It goes through creating a new project, based on a simple side-scroller. You will then learn how to tweak the game to make it more fun. Finally you will add a new game object. The tutorial should only take about 10 minutes.
items.name: Side scroller

items.description: In this beginner's tutorial you learn how to capture player input and make a character move and animate. You will also learn about game objects, components and collections.
items.name: Walking astronaut

items.description: In this beginner's tutorial you learn how to make realistic movement using vectors and some simple vector algebra.
items.name: Movement

items.description: In this medium difficulty tutorial you build an in-game GUI, a GUI screen for level selection and a start screen for a simple multi level mobile game.
items.name: Colorslide

items.description: In this tutorial you will create the embryo of a small shooter game. This is a good starting point if you are new to Defold.
items.name: War battles

items.description: If you are new to Defold, this guide will help you to get started with script logic together with a few of the building blocks in Defold.
items.name: Snake

items.description: If you are new to Defold, this guide will help you to lab with a few of the building blocks in Defold and run script logic.
items.name: 15 puzzle

items.description: In this tutorial you will convert a shader from shadertoy.com to Defold.
items.name: Shadertoy

items.description: In this tutorial we will look at how to create online multiplayer games in Defold using the open-source Nakama game server from Heroic Labs.
items.name: Creating online games using Nakama and Defold

items.description: In this blog post we'll look at how to add the Game Distribution SDK to an existing game or how to create one from scratch. We will also look at how to submit your game for distribution through the Game Distribution network.
items.name: Releasing HTML5 games on Game Distribution

items.description: In this guest tutorial Paweł Jarosz, developer of Witchcrafter: Empire Legends, share his experience learning shader programming in general and for Defold in particular.
items.name: Shaders for Beginners

items.description: In this tutorial you will create a full screen post effect in Defold.
items.name: Color grading

items.description: In this article, you go through the implementation of a basic tile-based 2D platformer in Defold. The mechanics you learn are moving left/right, jumping and falling.
items.name: Platformer (OLD)

items.description: In this tutorial you start with an empty project and build a complete runner game with an animated character, physics collision, pickups and scoring.
items.name: Runner (OLD)

items.description: In this tutorial you will build a complete little puzzle game with a start screen, the mechanics of the game and simple level progression in the form of increasing difficulty.
items.name: Magic link (OLD)

items.description: If you are new to Defold, this guide will help you getting your bearings right in the editor. It also explains the basic ideas and the most common building blocks in Defold - game objects, collections, scripts and sprites.
items.name: Building a car (OLD)

items.description: In this sample, you learn effects to present a main menu.
items.name: Main menu (OLD)

items.description: In this sample, you learn how to use a parallax effect to simulate depth in the game world.
items.name: Parallax (OLD)

items.description: In this sample, you learn effects for score counting.
items.name: Hud (OLD)

items.description: In this sample, you learn effects to show the score counting that could occur when a level has been completed.
items.name: Level complete (OLD)

items.description: These tutorials illustrate several common features of the Defold Game Engine, to include: (a) Image Procedures, (b) Dragging and Dropping Game Objects, (c) various Game Object Movement Techniques, (d) Preliminary use of 2d Physics based Collisions, (e) Graphic User Interface (GUI), and (f) an introduction to Defold Levels, Messaging and Menu Development.
items.name: Tactx Studios tutorials

items.description: This game programming series by Game from Scratch covers covers all aspects of 2D game development in Defold.
items.name: Game from Scratch video tutorials

items.description: This 7 episode series of introductory tutorials will be walking you through the essential building blocks needed to design and develop great games.
items.name: Defold introduction by Tactx Studios

items.description: In this session you’ll learn about how to install Defold on your desktop (Mac or Windows) as well as get oriented to the Defold Editor.
items.name: Defold Installation and Overview by Tactx Studios

items.description: This session will provide instructions on how to load images to your Defold game project as well as how to position them within your game.  Some basic animation techniques are also described.
items.name: Defold Image Procedures by Tactx Studios

items.description: A walkthough is provided on how you can support a user selecting a specific game object and dragging it to a new location within your game.
items.name: Defold Drag and Drop by Tactx Studios

items.description: This tutorial describes the procedures needed to move a Game Object using either a pre-defined path, or based on user inputs via mouse or touch.
items.name: Defold Movement by Tactx Studios

items.description: Leveraging Defold’s Physics Engine – this tutorial reviews the concept of a collision object, used to trigger when one game object touches another, effects of gravity and bounce features.
items.name: Defold Physics by Tactx Studios

items.description: A detailed description is provided on how you can incorporate button animations within the GUI as well as text notifications to users.
items.name: Defold GUI by Tactx Studios

items.description: The final tutorial in this introductory series provides an explanation on how to accommodate multiple game levels to support different scenes or game chapters – as well as how to exchange information between game components.
items.name: Defold Levels and Lua Modules by Tactx Studios

items.description: This is a new series of tutorials focused on Defold.
items.name: Game Developers video tutorials

items.description: This Tower Defense Tutorial will teach you the basics on how to incorporate the following features into a game: (1) splashscreens, (2) level selection menus, (3) help screens, (4) tank strikes, (5) tower placement, (6) fire exchange, (7) health resources, and (8) victory conditions.
items.name: Build a Tower Defense game by Tactx Studios

items.description: A collection of tutorials covering topics such as procedural 2D terrain and grids and arrays.
items.name: Sergey Lerg's video tutorials

items.description: This series of videos shows how Defold can be used for procedural content generation.
items.name: Procedural Content Generation in Defold
